mtstandard.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of The Montana Standard, a daily newspaper serving Butte, Montana, and the northeastern portion of the state.  

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Montana Standard is owned by Lee Enterprises, a publicly traded company based in Iowa that owns more than 40 daily newspapers, including The St. Louis Post-Dispatch. The site runs advertising and sells subscriptions.  

Content

MTStandard.com covers politics, government, crime, education, and business in and around Butte, Montana. It publishes state and regional news from other Lee outlets in Montana, including the Billings Gazette and Missoulian. The site features a section on coverage of the outdoors, and has a news section called 406politics (Montana’s area code is 406). It also  publishes news on high school and college sports from 406mtsports.com, a site operated by a group of Lee newspapers.

The site also runs national and international content from The Associated Press and Tribune Content Agency.

Credibility

Articles generally draw on a variety of sources and are fact-based and balanced. Headlines accurately reflect content. The site runs corrections, which appear in the form of an “editor’s note” or “correction.” Opinion is published in a separate section.

In 2018, the Montana Newspaper Association awarded The Montana Standard first place in the news category for an article about mercury contamination of the Clark Fork River. It won another first place award from the same group in the investigative reporting category, for a series that the paper said revealed harassment of small Montana meat processing plants by the federal government.

Transparency

Articles by Montana Standard reporters include their name and contact information. A Contact Staff page lists the paper’s editors and other staff, with titles, email addresses, phone numbers, and Twitter profiles.

The site does not clearly disclose that it is owned by Lee Enterprises. The Montana Standard did not respond to an email and a phone call from NewsGuard seeking comment on its ownership disclosure.

Advertisements are differentiated from editorial content.

History

The Montana Standard was first published in 1876 under the name Butte Miner. The paper’s name was changed to The Montana Standard in 1928.
